data.Name: Suzanne Levine
data.staff_bio: Suzanne C. Levine is currently ICI's Geographic Information Systems (GIS) intern while she works towards her certificate in GIS at UMass Boston. She supports ICI programs by spatially analyzing data and providing cartographic services. Additionally, she analyzes transportation options in Central/Western Mass for employees with intellectual disabilities using GIS. Suzanne has been working in disability communities since 1993 as a freelance documentary photographer. In 1996 she co-produced the award-winning video Disabled Women: Visions and Voices from the 4th World Conference on Women. Also in 1996, she published the book Volver a Vivir/Return to Life, about how six people who have spinal cord injuries work together toward independent living and self-sufficiency. In 1998 she founded the National Center on Disability and Journalism (NCDJ), a nonprofit dedicated to educating journalists and journalism educators about reporting on disability. She is now transferring her vision to studying way-finding for people with disabilities in urban environments via GIS.
